snippet: Many of the 32 young members of the Blue Waves could barely swim when the team was formed 18 months ago. Now they are winning races.
abstract: Blue Waves, swim team that practices at BronxWorks' Carolyn McLaughlin Community Center on Grand Concourse, has gone from group of beginners to winners of swim meets around region; team was idea of Eileen Towey, aquatics director for BronxWorks, whose goal is to offer children in South Bronx experience of being part of team.
lead_paragraph: Many of the 32 young members of the Blue Waves could barely swim when the team was formed 18 months ago. Now they are winning races.

headline.main: Against the Odds, a South Bronx Swim Team Finds Success
headline.print_headline: Against the Odds, a South Bronx Swim Team Finds Success
